msgSnippet: Hi, You can test applets with JFCUnit, an extension for Swing. A sample is attached below. CS (Germany) ... !!! SAMPLE WITH MOCKOBJECTS !!! import
messageBody:
Hi,

You can test applets with JFCUnit, an extension for Swing.

A sample is attached below.

CS (Germany)




--------------------------------------------
!!! SAMPLE WITH MOCKOBJECTS !!!

import junit.extensions.jfcunit.JFCTestCase;
import junit.extensions.jfcunit.JFCTestHelper;
import org.easymock.EasyMock;
import org.easymock.MockControl;

import javax.swing.*;
import java.util.*;

public class ReportFilterAppletTest extends JFCTestCase {

private JFCTestHelper helper = null;
private JFrame frame = null;
private MyApplet applet = null;

public MyAppletTest( String name ) {
super( name );
}

public void setUp() {

/*-- initialize
--*/
helper = new JFCTestHelper();

/*-- JFrame und Applet
--*/
frame = new JFrame();
frame.setName( "JFrame" );
applet = new MyApplet( appletMock, "JFrame" );


}

public void tearDown() {
/*-- Fenster-Ressourcen nach jedem Test wieder
--*/
helper.cleanUp(this);
}

/**
* Testet Ausfuhrungsrecht
*/
public void testIt()
throws Exception {

applet.init();
frame.setContentPane( applet.getContentPane() );
frame.setSize( 600, 800 );
frame.show();

/*-- BEGIN Test --*/

/*-- Teste, ob die Applet-ContentPane umbennannt
--*/
Component component = findComponent( "contenpane" );
junit.framework.Assert.assertNotNull( "contenpane is null", component );
assertTrue( flag, componentName, component );

/*-- END Test --*/

}
